name: happiness. machine.
description:
I guess everyone bought the machine when it came out
The perfect smile 
The perfect mood
The perfect you
All it took was a liter of blood
And an hour of cranking the rusted lever
To achieve perfect emptiness 
The ribbons that floated from the box 
Would grasp and pull at skin and lips
Contorting then into the face that would
Mathematically receive the most empty adoration from uninterested followers
After a while
It was the only way anyone could emote 
Unable to to stop the eternal spin of the lever 
Unable to birth anything that was not manufactured 
The ribbons lived in their face
Threaded their pores 
Became fibers in atrophied muscles 
It melted urethras and generated a singular stream of piss
That poured from the blue light 
And into the dried eyes of those
